name: Crowne Plaza Abu Dhabi - Yas Island

reviews.text: A calm & quiet hotel located away from the city on the Yas Island close to the F1 Circuit and Ferrari World Theme Park. Excellent food served in the restaurant. A must for a relaxing holiday as well as F1 Fans and Golfers.
reviews.title: A Relaxing Hotel

reviews.text: After a week of hard work in Dubai, for my last night in the UAE I chose the Crowne Plaza Yas Island, and I'm really happy about my decision.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its location is only good if you're attending the Yas Circuit, Ferrari World or any other venue in the island. But in my case I just wanted to relax a bit in the outdoor swimming pool (great feeling for a European in February!), as well as the sauna and steam bath. The Corniche is about half an hour away, but taxis are very cheap and reliable, so that was no problem at all.
reviews.title: Just Perfect.....

reviews.text: As for the hotel, I read that it had been chosen among the 25 trendiest hotels in the Middle East by Trip Advisor reviewers. The common areas looked very nice and so did the room. I was given once with a balcony and nice views, although you need some engineering skills to open the door to access the balcony!
reviews.title: Excellent property - minor issues with food orders

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food at the lounge was great, both in the evening and for breakfast. Access costs about AED 300, but as a Priority Club Platinum member it was offered for just AED 50, which is a great deal.
reviews.title: Great hotel.. Look out for real great deals online

reviews.text: the hotel overall is a good option around yas island. the lobby is small but the attachment to pool is good. the interior of the property is amazing. the rooms are very comfortable. the restaurants are also good and in addition the hotel have a great bar which is also called dubai longest bar due to its immensely long bar counter. the bad point about the property is that it don't have any club for which you have to go to yas viceroy. the ferrari world and water world are very near to hotel and the hotel offer free shuttle to water world,ferrari world and abu dhabi but the last shuttle is in the evening which is not a good time since its a bit early for the holiday.
reviews.title: A GOOD HOTEL OVERALL

reviews.text: We are about to clock up a month (husband entering second month) at the Crowne Plaza. Highly recommend this hotel especially for frequent visitors or extended stays whilst relocating.
reviews.title: A great place to stay for long term and relocating to Abu Dhabi

reviews.text: We are staying with a number of work colleagues in the same boat. Nobody wants to leave!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel offers great food, service, rooms are nice/tasteful, beds are sooo comfortable with feather donnas and crisp sheets.
reviews.title: A nice place to relax after a long day in the city

reviews.text: We have been in a suite for almost 2 months as we settle into AD permanently. The hotel rates above and beyond for the following:
reviews.title: Good Overall Hotel

reviews.text: Although outside Abu Dhabi itself, this hotel is convenient for the airport and about a 20 minute drive from downtown. Rooms are spacious and have a balcony.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The swimming pool is nice and a good way to wind down at the end of a working day. I stay in about 40 hotels a year and this is one of my favourites; I would stay here in preference to the Abu Dhabi Intercontinental (and I always get a suite there!); bring earplugs as the grand prix circuit and airprot flightpath are nearby.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel... be clear on your 'stay' objective.. vacation / business/ tourism?

reviews.text: This is a very good hotel. I stayed here for 3 nights on business with other colleagues. The quality of the hotel, rooms, decors, cleanliness was one of the best that I have stayed in. Brand new, shinning, posh, polished, great decor and ambiance. Its new, immaculate clean, everything here is bright and shining. The various floor corridors were the best that i have seen so far. Very trendy and posh. Hotel service is good as well. Jhing asia served good breakfast / lunch also the pool terrace bar great in the evenings.
reviews.title: Good stay

reviews.text: It is right next to the Yas Hotel and the formula 1 track. Thus I believe it is best for formula 1 trips and business trips (proximity to the track, business visits- an excellent place to stay for 3/4 days with only occasional and planned sight seeing trips out)
reviews.title: 2 days of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a very formal and business traveler kind of a hotel, It is not a resort as such so if you are looking for a vacation, beaches, spas (i did see a spa center) and relaxing activities, this might not be the place. If Abudhabi tourism is the objective then go for something inside the city. The location for this hotel might not be ideal for tourism.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel on Yas Island

reviews.text: aside from one bad insident, i really like this hotel. it's not cheap but you pay for service as always. i stayed twice at the club rooms which gives you access to the club launge where you can have breakfast, use internet or simply chill. The rooms are great and the service was very good. I stay at the crown plaza whenever i am on Yas for an event.
reviews.title: great hotel and service

reviews.text: this is a hotel I recommend in YAS island. we stayed there for one night as family break but we're definitely coming back. the room is spacious with big bathroom. it has all the standard stuff plus nice big LCD TV, an Ipod dock. what impressed me the most was the pillow fragrance to help you relax and sleep. the hotel swimming pool is sizable with separate one for kids. kids have closed playing area with painting, drawing activities. the hotel has squash court so make sure you bring your rackets. the staff are well trained and extremely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: good one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as our cruise ended in Abu Dhabi and being an F1 fan wanted to visit the race track. The hotel was perfect! Located an easy 10 minute walk from the track entrance but there is a free circular bus that leaves just outside the hotel on the hour (from 12 noon to 9pm) which stops at the circuit and also Ferrari World. The hotel has a free shuttle available to the Mall and taxis are cheap to use to get around.
reviews.title: Simply the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at 9.30am and found we could check in as our room was ready. This was a standard room but was large, bright and comfortable. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Tea/coffee making facilities and a mini bar were provided. The glass window to the bathroom was a bit strange but although the blinds hid any embarrassment they did nothing to block the light if you got up during the night.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: During our stay we ate in the breakfast restaurant, Stills restaurant and beside the pool - all the food was well cooked and well presented.
reviews.title: Absolutely Excellent

reviews.text: I was in Abu Dhabi for a two week business trip and decided to return to the Crowne Plaza, Yas Island. As prior experience indicated, it was a good choice with a comfortable room and a great view of the links golf course. The location was convenient to where I was meeting and the service at the hotel is quite good.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Abu Dhabi

reviews.text: I was dependent on the wireless Internet to stay in contact with my office, but, although the speed was good, I was unable to connect to my company's network due to apparent firewall issues. I contacted the technical support staff at the hotel for four days in a row, but they were unable to resolve the issue. Unfortunately, this made it necessary for me to cut short my stay at this hotel and move to another after the first week. If it weren't for the technical difficulties, I would have remained happily at the Crowne Plaza.
reviews.title: Simply Awesome

reviews.text: I was on a business trip and they were very nice and upgraded me to one of their top floors sea/ golf course facing rooms. The views were amazing.
reviews.title: It's the closest you can get to a Royal treatment!

reviews.text: The room was spacious and very comfortable.
reviews.title: amazing place for families and relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You should never miss their buffet breakfasts and dinners. You are spoilt for choices.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Crown on 2 occasions and whilst it only a 4 star it is very good. the rooms are fab, (not quite sure i can get my head around the big glass window between the bathrooma and the room), comfortable, big, bright. Bathrooms are good, shower and bath great. my only criticism is that on both occasions i have been when the hotel is busy and i have not been able to get a sun lounger, although last time there were some cushions on the grass which was better than nothing, a small table would have been nice. the staff at helpful and friendly and this is the best Crowni have ever stayed at, i hate all the other design of the Crown hotels, but this one is so much better and this time the breakfast was not too crowded and we were able to eat in the main restaurant.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

reviews.text: I loved it! the rooms were lovely, spic and span and the facilities wonderful.
reviews.title: fantastic experience!

reviews.text: I especially liked the tiny box on my pillow with lavender oil and spray for the pillow that was marked " This will help you sleep". It did!
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: We all know how difficult it is to sleep in hotel rooms, especially when it's a business trip!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel if want to be in/around Yas Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was really good, std american fare.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Why should I be surprised. Well we were overnighting (awful verbing I know) at the Crowne Plaza. We arrived late and left for the airport early. We didn't use the golf course, didn't go to Ferrari World, didn't go to the restaurants didn't walk about and never really tested the staff. Essentially we arrived, went to bed got up and left.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good

reviews.text: But within these constraints: the arrival (at 1.00am in the morning) was friendly
reviews.title: A great business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and (importantly) efficient, the room was spacious, modern and very very comfortable. The bed was much better than one would expect and overall a thoroughly pleasant stay. We stayed in a club room and had a fine breakfast in the club lounge. Always take club if you can. So if you are just staying overnight do stay here. If you are going to the motor racing I'm sure this is a great spot. Friendly people and I'm sure everything else works just as well.
reviews.title: Great choice of hotel
Fraudulent Billing
reviews.text: I often stay here when visiting Abu Dhabi on business. The rooms overlooking the pool and nearby golf course provide a relaxing atmosphere which complement the Club Lounge, bar food / room service and free internet. When packaged together they make it an ideal place to stay. Its close to the International Airport and Grand Prix circuit so expect the odd bit of noise if you like to sleep with windows open rather than "Air Con on". There are also a selection of hotels near by which can also provide you with an alternate dining experience if you fancy a change of scene. Apart from the usual hotel lobby gift shops there's no shops in walking distance but if you are here on business and perhaps fancy a nice dip in the pool after a hard days work - you wont go wrong with this hotel.

My wife and I had an excellent time at this hotel, we were well received on our arrival, greeted as Priority Club members. There are plenty of places to eat in the hotel and the food was of very high standard as was the accommodation.
reviews.title: Very comfortable hotel close to airport with lap pool.

reviews.text: Emirates airlines put me in this hotel on a layover so I can't comment on price. I had a very nice room overlooking the pool, part of the golf course, and the water beyond. I thought the glassed in bathroom was a bit over the top, but it was a great bathroom :). I loved my little balcony, too, though it was too hot and humid to actually go out on it. The bed was extremely comfortable. The buffet was the best hotel buffet I have ever experienced anywhere. It had great foods from all different cuisines and they cooked to my specification. The hotel has a spa and a very good fitness room. For muslim travelers, there is a prayer room. There are some attractions and activities close by the hotel - a big shopping mall, the indoor waterpark, the formula 1 race track.
reviews.title: Enjoyable experience

reviews.text: the staff is totally stupid they can enter in ur room any time even if the sing is (do not disturb) it happend wit me 4 times and the duty manager and other staff is totally not helpfull and coperative ll give u lame excuses any wayz u ppl should lock ur doors if u r planing to stay in crowne plaza..More over the food is also not good it was cold n the meat was nt cooked properly guys i dont recommend u ppls to go n stay in crowne plaza Thanks Ahmad
reviews.title: Very Bad exp with crowne plaza

reviews.text: I am so glad to say that last night was yet another perfect night at the Stills Bar in Crowne PLaza. Unfortunately I have been working alot and have not returned since my last visit however, last night my friends and I visted the Bar for a night out. As usual a wonderful friendly smile from the Security gaurd and a pleasent welcome back from the staff as though I never left. Last night we decided to stick to beers and I must say the Carlsberg was fresh on the tap. Our waitress the wonderfully friendly, well managed Sibongili ( female waitress from LadySmith South Africa) was at her best again, serving us with her award winning smile every time she topped us up. We were a big crowd last night, south africans, spanish, norwegin, philliphine, austraillian and californian, and we ALL enjoyed the experiance. I will def be back again when I get a chance. Thank you to all at the bar for another beautiful evening in a beautiful place with wonderful people.
reviews.title: Yet another WONDERFUL EVENING IN SUCH A WONDERFUL PLACE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as it is very close to the airport and F1 circuit. We checked in very late and received a genuinly warm welcome. The room was modern, clean and well appointed with lots of electrical sockets, flat screen tv with plenty of international channels, minbar and excellent bathroom.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet the next morning was plentiful and varied. The waiting staff very helpful. We enjoyed the pool area and pool service. We took the complimentary shuttle into the city but as the last shuttle back to the hotel left at about 4.30pm we caught a taxi back.
reviews.title: Fantastic !... Love the pool, Love the location, Superb for Ferrari World and the F1 Circuit

reviews.text: We have just concluded our event and we were treated with excellent experience overall. From check-in staff, room service, concierge to the meeting room staff. All of them one better than the other in terms of arranging all the facilities and also taking care of us right through and also beign so accommodating with even our last minute requests.
reviews.title: A complete package
A really relaxing week of comfort
reviews.text: On the whole a great experience and a total package to experience...

Writing this as I sit by the pool relaxing and enjoying the refreshing cool water and comfy sun beds. Our room is spotlessly clean with a really comfortable bed and a balcony which looks out across the adjacent Golf Links. We are taking advantage of the Club facilities so enjoy a good breakfast in the 8th floor lounge and copious amounts of very tasty Merlot in the evening as the sun sets into the sea.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: Maybe if one wants to enjoy the not over prolific tourist delights of Abu Dhabi a hotel closer to the city would be better but the Crowne Plaze is very handy for Ferrari World, a really big water park and the Grand Prix Circuit. Food in the 'Stills' bar and restaurant is excellent and filling!
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Yas Island area.

reviews.text: All in all a great hotel and destination for a relaxing week of doing nothing but soaking up the sun and recharging the batteries!
reviews.title: Best hotel in its vicinity

reviews.text: I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Yas Island for a couple of nights and enjoyed the experience. The rooms are large, the linen is of good quality, and I really enjoyed the "sleep aid" kit, which consists of some basic, but efficient in my case, aromatherapy. The views from my room were nice but, as in much of Abu Dhabi, you can see some construction going. The room was quiet and it was easy to set it to a comfortable temperature. There isn't a lot to do in the immediate surroundings, but as this was a business trip, it suited me fine. I enjoyed breakfast and found the staff courteous and efficient. The proximity to the airport is a bonus, and a taxi to the airport will set you back just AED20.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: Great value for money. Nice rooms (pay a bit more for a balcony). Great outdoor pool. Squash court. Stills bar - definitely the best bar in Abu dhabi .... Maybe not saying much but I would like it anywhere. Good service, great staff.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Abu dhabi

reviews.text: I had a nice 20 days stay at Crowne plaza, yas island. Rooms are really nice and cozy and give you a very warm feeling. It's always refreshing to cross the staff people with their ever smiling faces around the clock. Gym facility was quite good. Also, a perfect weekend can be spent within the hotel without even moving out. Starting from morning gym and then the delicious brunch extended over the morning and the afternoon. Also, you can chill at the pool and the bar "Sundowners" is always there to serve you. With a small nap or a stroll to the yas beach, one can always come back to sit back at sundowners and later in the evening, you can be a nice bar cum restaurant "Stills" where you would find a good crowd to cheer with. Also, they start playing club house music with a live DJ but that's not a really big thing to look for.
reviews.title: Would love to stay again and again

reviews.text: Over all, Crowne plaza gives a royal treat with all its facilities plus an amazing spa zone to relax on a hectic day. Would love to stay at the same place if I have a chance to visit yas island.
reviews.title: Decent enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Probably as good as any of the hotels on this part of Yas; all are good value and there's not much between them in my experience. The addition of the Yas Beach facility is very welcome, though when we stayed it was just too hot to venture out. But on a previous visit I saw the Yas beach and its very welcome that residents at the CP get free access and a shuttle (though its only 8 mins walk away).
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!
Excellent Hotel - but a long way out of town
reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza was an excellent hotel where my wife and toddler stayed on a stopover while flying with Etihad. The staff were fantastic and ensured we all had a relaxing time. The rooms were an excellent standard (although we would have been disappointed to be allocated one without a balcony). Club facilities and catering were good - again great staff made the difference. We ate breakfast in the main restaurant each day and were not disappointed. The Lebanese was also good although expensive. The main drawback is the distance from town (30 mins in a taxi) and unless you are going to Ferrari world there is nothing on Yas Island. Dubai Creek is 90 minutes and 250 Dirhams in a taxi - the 45 quoted by the hotel and concierge is to the industrial southern outskirts. In summary a great place for a stopover but not a good base to see the emirates.

reviews.title: Maybe a crown but certainly not a jewel
reviews.text: One of this disastrous hotel in the UAE opened to quickly : No tooth brush in the bathroom, no bath robes, had to wait hours with the room service to get ones... No hot water either for my shower... What a shame for a brand like Crown Plaza !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disastrous stay even as a gift by Ethiad because a fly cancelation.
reviews.title: "It just does not get better"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Crown Plaza Hotels just don't get better. Helpful and prompt service, without obsequiousness, Excellent beautifully maintained facilities, breakfast buffet - simply incredible choices. Concierge and front services make one feel like a valued family member. Restaurant on the ground floor more like a pub, not remarkable. Lebanese restaurant OK, but there are better.
reviews.title: i love it

reviews.text: We arrived very late in the evening and we could not fault the front desk staff, extremely efficient and they kindly upgraded our suite which was a great start to a fabulous holiday All the restaurant staff or the room cleaner were just so friendly and really made our holiday very special, lovely pool area with great service. All in all for a week away, what more could we have asked for!, we will absolutely come back and stay here
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: The Crowne Plaza at Yas is a comfortable hotel just a few minutes drive from the airport. Staff are quite helpful and attentive and the accommodations were more than adequate for a three night stay. The room has plenty of closet space and the bed was about as good as one can expect from a hotel. Although there are several attractions nearby, my meeting schedule kept me from enjoying the surroundings and the outdoor pool.
reviews.title: A Solid Choice in Abu Dhabi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down side to the hotel is the lack of dining choices. There is one central dining room that is buffet only, but you can get snack foods and sandwiches in the lobby bar. I decided on room service two nights and it at least offered better choices than the buffet. Breakfast was included in the room rate and the variety of offerings was pretty good. On at least one morning, though, the scrambled eggs looked watery and under cooked, so I passed on those.
reviews.title: close to Yas Marina circuit and Ferrari World

reviews.text: All in all, it is a solid choice for a short to medium stay in Abu Dhabi.
reviews.title: Impressive Hotel on Yas

reviews.text: Location: perfect for those, who are interested in the circuit and ferrari world. All other attractions, as well as supermarkets and malls are quite far away from Yas.
reviews.title: Friendly pool staff but is that enough?

reviews.text: Rooms: we lived in superior double room. Small, but cozy. With a view directly on Yas Marina Circuit. We loved it!
reviews.title: Great Escape From the City

aka: Crowne Plaza Abu Dhabi - Yas Island Hotel
description: Fuse business with leisure at the Crowne Plaza Abu Dhabi Yas Island hotel, located in the UAE's electrifying sports and entertainment hub.Leave your car with our complimentary valet and enter the vibrant Lobby at Crowne Plaza Abu Dhabi Yas Island, with its deep blue, turquoise and gold design. Relax in the lavish spherical booths hanging from the high ceiling. A vista of verdant mangroves stretches out from our 24-hour Lobby lounge, or you can head to your room or Suite for a soothing rest in our luxury bedding.Crowne Plaza Abu Dhabi Yas Island is next to Yas Links golf course and minutes' walk to both Yas Marina Circuit, home of the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, and Ferrari World Abu Dhabi theme park. You're 10 minutes' drive from Abu Dhabi International Airport, while our complimentary shuttle wings you to city-centre souks and shopping malls in 20 minutes.With 10 meeting rooms and a wealth of dining options, our hotel is primed for business and banquets. The Kids' Club will entertain the children while you energise in our Fitness Centre or squash court. Swim up to Sundowner bar for a cocktail in our pool as the sun sinks into the Gulf.Your Concierge can book tickets for Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre's year-round events calendar. Join us for gourmet dining during the Grand Prix and be sure to treat Crowne Plaza Abu Dhabi Yas Island as your second home.
